item.title: PIK3CA
item.description:
DrugBank ID: db14954
DrugCentral: pik3ca
Synonymous :phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate 3-kinase catalytic subunit alpha isoform | pik3ca


Drug Sentece Context


Table 1. Analysis of context sentence of pik3ca gene in 5 abstracts.

pmid sentence
23558893 Epidermal growth factor receptor gene mutations were sought by means of real-time polymerase chain reaction (PCR) and direct sequencing, KRAS gene mutations by mutant-enriched PCR, and PIK3CA and BRAF gene mutations by direct sequencing.
25174276 The samples were analyzed for mutations in EGFR, KRAS, BRAF, PIK3CA, NRAS, MEK1, AKT1, PTEN, and HER2 and amplifications in EGFR, MET, PIK3CA, FGFR1, and FGFR2. […] Genetic alterations were detected in 4 patients (one KRAS mutation and 3 PIK3CA amplifications). […] Moreover, significance was maintained if the patients only harbored PIK3CA amplification. […] A total 16 genetic mutations were identified in the 9 patients’ samples (4 TP53 mutations, 3 APC mutations, 3 PIK3CA mutations, and 2 VHL mutations, etc.) by deep sequencing.
25514803 The commonest genetic variations were clustered in two main pathways: the p53/DNA repair (TP53, SMACB1, and BAP1) and phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase-AKT pathways (PDGFRA, KIT, KDR, HRAS, PIK3CA, STK11, and NF2). […] PIK3CA:c.1173A>G mutation, STK11:rs2075606 (T>C), or TP53:rs1042522 (Pro/Pro) was significantly associated with time to progressive disease (TTPD; all p values < 0.01).
25952930 Transducers of these pathways, such as PIK3CA-mTOR-AKT, MAPK, and ezrin/radixin/moesin (ERM) could therefore be exploited as possible targets for pharmacological intervention. […] EGFR, KRAS and PIK3CA).
26463840 Driver gene mutations in BRAF, EGFR, ERBB2, HRAS, KRAS, MET, NRAS, PIK3CA, STK11, and ephrin receptor genes (EPHA1-8, 10 and EPHB1-4, 6) were studied for both LAC and MM, and in BAP1, CUL1, CDKN2A, and NF2 for MM.
26870271 Mutations in various genes, including EGFR, KRAS, HER2, BRAF, and PIK3CA, which are frequently detected in non-small cell lung cancer, were not detected in the 4 cell lines. microRNA-34b/c is a direct transcriptional target of p53 and is often silenced in MPM by promoter methylation.
31443309 Additionally, the process of pathogenesis is greatly affected by activating mutations of EGFR, KRAS, PIK3CA, BRAF, MET, EML4/ALK and RET, which correlate with an increased incidence of MPE.
32369821 The Illumina TruSight Tumor 15 was used to evaluate 250 amplicons from 15 genes associated with solid tumors (AKT1, GNA11, NRAS, BRAF, GNAQ, PDGFRA, EGFR, KIT, PIK3CA, ERBB2, KRAS, RET, FOXL2, MET,and TP53).
